snippet: Maharashtra, which includes Mumbai, is the latest Indian state to issue such bans, imposing penalties of up to five years in prison or a fine for violations.
abstract: Indian state Maharashtra becomes first in country to ban possession and sale of beef, leveling fines and up to five years in prison for violations; measure was sought by Hindu rightists and opposed by Muslims.
lead_paragraph: Maharashtra, which includes Mumbai, is the latest Indian state to issue such bans, imposing penalties of up to five years in prison or a fine for violations.

headline.main: Indian State Bans Possession and Sale of Beef
headline.print_headline: In First, Indian State Bans Possession and Sale of Beef
